# The `PriorityQueue` Class Template Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/priorityqueue">PriorityQueue</a> - This class behaves like std::priority&#95;queue and provides a few additional convenience functions. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>template &lt;class T, class Sequence = std::vector&lt;T&gt;, class Compare = std::less&lt;typename Sequence::value&#95;type&gt;&gt;

clear - Erase all elements from the queue.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/priorityqueue-h/#l00076">76</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/priorityqueue-h">PriorityQueue.h</a>.

### erase&#95;one() {#a89ce59a53dfd16d3194518d0c209ff97}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class T, class Sequence = std::vector&lt;T&gt;, class Compare = std::less&lt;typename Sequence::value&#95;type&gt;&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void llvm::PriorityQueue&lt; T, Sequence, Compare &gt;::erase&#95;one (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> T &amp; t)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
erase&#95;one - Erase one element from the queue, regardless of its position.

This operation performs a linear search to find an element equal to t, but then uses all logarithmic-time algorithms to do the erase operation.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/priorityqueue-h/#l00047">47</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/priorityqueue-h">PriorityQueue.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### reheapify() {#a79d40f085693726bbebb3a1d67303c01}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class T, class Sequence = std::vector&lt;T&gt;, class Compare = std::less&lt;typename Sequence::value&#95;type&gt;&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void llvm::PriorityQueue&lt; T, Sequence, Compare &gt;::reheapify ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
reheapify - If an element in the queue has changed in a way that affects its standing in the comparison function, the queue&#39;s internal state becomes invalid.

Calling <a href="#a79d40f085693726bbebb3a1d67303c01">reheapify()</a> resets the queue&#39;s state, making it valid again. This operation has time complexity proportional to the number of elements in the queue, so don&#39;t plan to use it a lot.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/priorityqueue-h/#l00070">70</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/priorityqueue-h">PriorityQueue.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
